wikipedia_page.main: Ian Campbell (26 April 1926 – 9 September 2007) was a Scottish politician who served as a backbench Labour Member of Parliament (MP) of the United Kingdom from 1970 to 1987.

link_mentions.page: John McFall, Baron McFall of Alcluith
response: He was first elected for the Dumbarton constituency, Scotland, at the 1987 general election, after the previous MP, Ian Campbell retired. His original majority was a little over 2,000. Dumbarton constituency was replaced with the new West Dunbartonshire constituency for the 2005 general election, which McFall won with a majority over 12,500.

response: *Ian Campbell (folk musician) (1933–2012), one of the leaders of the British folk revival of the 1960s
**Ian Campbell Folk Group, the group led by Ian Campbell, which included Dave Pegg and Dave Swarbrick, later of Fairport Convention
*Ian Campbell (opera director) (born 1945), Australian-born opera singer, stage director and administrator

*Ian Campbell (public servant) (21st century), Australian public servant
*Ian Campbell (rugby union) (born 1928), former Chilean rugby union footballer, of Scottish descent

*Ian Campbell, 12th Duke of Argyll (1937–2001), Scottish Peer and Chief of Clan Campbell
*Ian Campbell (apothecary) (active circa 1992–2007), former officer of the British Medical Household
He lost this seat back to Douglas-Home in 1950, but was elected for Dunbartonshire West at a by-election later that year.  He held this seat until he retired in 1970, to be replaced by Ian Campbell.

response: *Ian Campbell, 81, British politician, MP for Dunbartonshire West (1970–1983) and Dumbarton (1983–1987).
* Ian Campbell, Labour MP 1983-87 for Dumbarton, and 1970-83 for Dunbartonshire West
